Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Tuesday February 4), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for tuesday, february 4th. microsoft is reportedly in advanced talks to invest in a major ai startup. according to insiders, the tech giant sees immense potential in ai innovation and aims to boost its capabilities in this area. this move aligns with microsoft's ongoing efforts to integrate ai more deeply into its product suite, which includes widely-used applications like microsoft office and azure cloud services.

in other news, facebook announced new privacy settings that will give users more control over their data. the social media company is rolling out features allowing users to customize who can see their posts and the type of ads they are served. facebook continues to face scrutiny over its handling of user data, and these changes are part of an effort to strengthen trust and transparency with its users globally.

meanwhile, amazon's latest earnings report has exceeded wall street expectations, driven by strong performance in its aws division. the cloud services sector remains a critical revenue driver for amazon, contributing significantly to the company’s growth, even amidst concerns about increasing competition in the cloud market.

finally, google's parent company alphabet has announced a new initiative focused on developing sustainable tech solutions. the company has pledged a substantial investment in research aimed at reducing carbon emissions and advancing eco-friendly technologies. this initiative is part of alphabet's broader commitment to being an environmentally responsible tech leader.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for tuesday, february 4th.

microsoft is reportedly in advanced talks to invest in a major ai startup. insiders say the tech giant is eyeing ai innovation's immense potential to enhance its product suite, which includes essentials like microsoft office and azure cloud services. this move is part of microsoft's broader effort to weave ai more deeply into its offerings.

in other news, facebook is rolling out new privacy settings designed to give users more control over their data. these updates will allow users to customize who sees their posts and the type of ads they receive. amid ongoing scrutiny over its data practices, facebook's changes aim to bolster trust and transparency with its global user base.

meanwhile, amazon has posted earnings that beat wall street expectations, with strong results from its aws division. the cloud services sector remains a vital revenue engine for amazon, driving the company's growth despite rising competition in the cloud market.

lastly, alphabet, google's parent company, is launching a new initiative focused on sustainable tech solutions. the company commits significant investment in research to reduce carbon emissions and advance eco-friendly technologies. this initiative underscores alphabet's dedication to being an environmentally responsible tech leader.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-209 Microsoft's Ai Venture 💼, Facebook's Privacy Overhaul 🔒, Amazon's Earnings Surprise 📈
Podcast Description:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for tuesday, february 4th.

  • microsoft ai investment: microsoft in advanced talks to invest in a major ai startup, aiming to enhance its product suite including microsoft office and azure cloud services with ai innovations.
  • facebook's new privacy settings: rolling out updates to give users more control over their data and improve transparency amid scrutiny over data practices.
  • amazon's strong earnings: amazon beats wall street expectations with strong results from its aws division, highlighting the continued importance of cloud services for growth.
  • alphabet's sustainable tech initiative: google's parent company launches an initiative focused on sustainable tech solutions, committing to reduce carbon emissions and advance eco-friendly technologies.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow.
